Package ohos.agp.text.richstyles

Class TabStopsRichStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.text.richstyles.RichStyle
      • ohos.agp.text.richstyles.TabStopsRichStyle

  • public class TabStopsRichStyle
extends RichStyle
    Implements the tab stop rich style, which allows you to specify possible tab stops in each paragraph. This class must be used in a RichText instance.
    Since:
    7
    See Also:
    RichText.setRichStyle(RichStyle, int, int, RangedRichStyle.Flag)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class ohos.agp.text.richstyles.RichStyle

    • Constructor Detail

      • TabStopsRichStyle

        public TabStopsRichStyle​(int defaultTabStop)
        A constructor used to create a TabStopsRichStyle instance based on the defaultTabStop.
        Parameters:
        defaultTabStop - Indicates the position of the default tab stop, in pixels. For example, if defaultTabStop is set to 100, the position of the tab stop is an integer multiple of 100, such as 100, 200, and so on.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the defaultTabStop is less than or equal to 0.
        Since:
        7

      • TabStopsRichStyle

        public TabStopsRichStyle​(List<Integer> tabStops,
                         int defaultTabStop)
        A constructor used to create a TabStopsRichStyle instance based on the specified tabStops and defaultTabStop.
        Parameters:
        tabStops - Indicates an array of tab stops, in pixels. If the actual number of tab stops in the text is greater than that in the array, the extra tab stops are treated as the defaultTabStop. Note that the values in the array must be in ascending order, for example, 50,150,300.
        defaultTabStop - Indicates the position of the default tab stop, in pixels. For example, if defaultTabStop is set to 100, the position of the tab stop is an integer multiple of 100, such as 100, 200, and so on.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the specified tabStops is null or the specified defaultTabStop is less than or equal to 0.
        Since:
        7

        public List<Integer> getTabStops​()
